instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used in the study on the rapid detection of micro insoluble solids (MIS) in industrial wastewater using an Internet of Things (IoT) platform?
Output: In the study on the rapid detection of micro insoluble solids (MIS) in industrial wastewater using an Internet of Things (IoT) platform, near-infrared (NIR) spectroscopy was used.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used to improve the calibration model for the detection of MIS in industrial wastewater?
Output: The spectral feature processing methods used to improve the calibration model for the detection of MIS in industrial wastewater were root mean square error (RMSE), coefficient correlation (CC), and relative RMSE (RRMSE).

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the prediction results of the calibration model and how far can this metric go in assessing the accuracy in the study on the rapid detection of micro insoluble solids (MIS) in industrial wastewater using an Internet of Things (IoT) platform?
Output: The metric chosen to evaluate the prediction results of the calibration model is the root mean square error (RMSE). This metric can assess the accuracy of the rapid detection of micro insoluble solids (MIS) in industrial wastewater using an Internet of Things (IoT) platform.

instruction: What intelligent chemometric methods were used in the study to enhance the NIR calibration model for accurate determination of micro insoluble solids (MIS) content in industrial wastewater?
Output: The intelligent chemometric methods used in the study to enhance the NIR calibration model for accurate determination of micro insoluble solids (MIS) content in industrial wastewater are the backward interval and synergy interval techniques in combination with the least square support vector machine (LSSVM) method.

instruction: Can the intelligent optimization of model parameters using biLSSVM and siLSSVM deep learning methodologies be used to improve the prediction results of the wastewater micro insoluble solids (MIS) content in the study on the rapid detection of MIS in industrial wastewater using an Internet of Things (IoT) platform?
Output: Yes, the intelligent optimization of model parameters using biLSSVM and siLSSVM deep learning methodologies can be used to improve the prediction results of the wastewater micro insoluble solids (MIS) content in the study on the rapid detection of MIS in industrial wastewater using an Internet of Things (IoT) platform. The study suggests that these methodologies, in combination with the adaptive selection of informative spectral wavelength variables, can enhance the accuracy of the NIR calibration model. The biLSSVM method was found to be the best for testing the model, while the siLSSVM method was the best for training the model. Therefore, the proposed deep learning methodologies are feasible for improving the prediction results in the rapid determination of wastewater MIS content using IoT-based NIR technology.
